intro: Syringa vulgaris var. transsilvanica, commonly known as the Transylvanian lilac, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe. It is characterized by its fragrant, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 2–4 meters and features dark green, ovate leaves. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often used in gardens and landscapes.
